thread.title: Blackhawks lackluster again in 4-1 loss to Capitals | Hockey
thread.title_full: Blackhawks lackluster again in 4-1 loss to Capitals | Hockey | ArcaMax Publishing

author: arcamax.com
title: Blackhawks lackluster again in 4-1 loss to Capitals | Hockey
text:
WASHINGTON -- After a mediocre performance against the Flyers on Wednesday night, Blackhawks coach Joel Quenneville has made some adjustments to his lineup.
But the changes didn't make much of a difference Thursday as the Capitals handled the Hawks, 4-1.
Quenneville inserted Kyle Baun into the lineup for Ryan Garbutt while moving Viktor Tikhonov up to the first line with Jonathan Toews and Marian Hossa to start the game. Then the line blender took over. Patrick Kane and Hossa swapped lines as Quenneville tried to look for a spark.
"I still think we're at that explore level right now," Quenneville said of his lineup. "Until we feel all four lines are going and we like the way they're rolling in a game."
But there was little to like Thursday.
The Capitals got on the board after T.J. Oshie scored from the slot 17 seconds into a Capitals' power play at 8 minutes, 48 seconds of the first period. It was Oshie's first goal as a Capital.
While the Hawks generated several more chances in the second period, goaltender Braden Holtby stopped them while the Capitals added another goal from John Carlson.
Matt Niskanen made it 3-0 early at 2:32 in the third period while Viktor Svedberg finally snapped the Hawks drought with his first-career goal at 3:13. The Hawks had gone over five periods without scoring a goal.
Alex Ovechkin, who missed the Capitals' last game after oversleeping and missing that morning's skate, scored the fourth goal to put the game away at 14:18 of the third period.
